abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Sustainable Energy Global Environmental Facility (GEF)
            Project of the Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia is to
            develop a sustainable market for energy efficiency (EE) and
            renewable energy (RE) by supporting the development of an
            enabling framework, institutional capacity, and necessary
            financing mechanisms. The closing date for the project will
            be extended from September 30, 2012 until January 31, 2013.
            The project has disbursed US$4.2 million out of the US$5.5
            million GEF grant and is well underway to reach its
            objectives. The project was restructured in 2010 after which
            good progress has been made. Phase one of an Energy
            Efficiency Retrofit Program has been successfully completed
            resulting in retrofits of 18 kindergartens and schools in
            six different municipalities. The extension is necessary to
            complete phase two of the above-mentioned Retrofit Program,
            which is planned to finance energy efficiency retrofits for
            13 schools and kindergartens in five municipalities.
            Procurement activities for the implementation of the
            retrofits are underway and bids have been received for all
            works. The estimated value of the works is US$2 million of
            which $1 million will be paid from the GEF grant. This will
            be the second extension of the project.
